text: I've been clearing a lot of games from my backlog this year (currently Bloodborne which is unsurprisingly amazing), and I have a feeling I'll soon get a Xenoblade itch and play XC2. I'll always remember stepping in this area and first seeing the huge waterfalls, probably the best vista in the game. I know quite a few people who didn't really like it, but I also enjoyed the thick forest with the dinosaurs moving around. One thing I didn't like is the Frontier Village, the huge tree was a pain to traverse.
author: SupraDarky

text:
I finished Xenoblade Chronicles 2 recently and its an absolute masterpiece.

If you loved XC1 you will love XC2.

text: I was gonna chime in the opposite of what recht was saying, 2 is good but its loaded with flaws left and right especially in the way it gimps exploration behind gatcha elements and that the story kind of doesnt do all it could with the setting kind of just feeling like your going to location to location without much progress or consequence past picking up party members that never really form relationships with one another. The good elements outweigh the bad for me but its definitely my least favorite xeno game granted i have yet to play the rather infamous xenosaga 2

text: XC2 is  by far my least favorite in the series. It tries way too hard to be XC1, unlike X, which had a very distinct identity. It has more grinding, more annoying quests, the world design and environments aren't nearly as good... Still enjoyed it, though.

author: Riemenschneider

text: Xenoblade 1 is a masterpiece, and Xenoblade 2 really just doesn't have anything that made 1 so great. 2 relies so god damn much on the worst anime tropes that it just becomes painful to watch cutscenes. The fan service in particular is just really excessive and obvious that it distracts from everything else. There are so many other JRPGs you could play instead of Xenoblade 2.
author: David Raygoza

text:
I started playing XC2 with the assumption that Monolith Soft couldn't create bad games, something I really believed after playing XC and XCX (XCX has flaws when it comes to story, but basically every other element is amazing, especially its overworld and gameplay). Sadly, XC2 turned out to be more or less a retelling from XC, but with squeaky anime girls everywhere, and a lot of them. Also it comes with an extremely generic main character (Rex look almost identical to the Sword Art Online or Attack on Titan guy, but with very ugly pants). I don't think I ever had such a bad aftertaste after a game. It's not necessarily a bad game (it's probably still good), but it tries way too hard to mimic XC, and the amount of fan service was way too much for me.

All I wanna say is, just because you like XC doesn't mean you'll like XC2. In order to appreciate a playthrough of XC2 you more or less need to be a hardcore anime fan who doesn't dislike fan service everywhere. In the future I'll unfortunately be very skeptical for future Monolith soft games..
author: Eirian Odalis

text:
I won't tell if I prefer XC or XC2 because I loved them both. Oh, and Torna too. ^^
